text: Barak Atlı (, ), Baragite () or Baraghida () is a village in northern Aleppo Governorate, northwestern Syria. Located halfway between Azaz and al-Rai, some north of the city of Aleppo and south of the border to the Turkish province of Kilis, the village administratively belongs to Nahiya Sawran in Azaz District. Nearby localities include to the west, Dudiyan to the east and Sawran to the south. In the 2004 census, Baraghida had a population of 995. ==References== Category:Turkmen communities in Syria
title: Baraghida
